name: whitebeam
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a kind of large deciduous tree (= one that loses its leaves in autumn and grows new ones in the spring) with leaves that are white underneath, and small red berries: Whitebeams do not root well from cuttings. Ley's Whitebeam is a critically endangered species, of which there are only 17 wild specimens left.
More examplesFewer examplesWe planted the whitebeam and bird cherry when we moved here, 20 years ago. Whitebeams are very sensitive to grazing by livestock and deer.
